bibl.title: Dispatch from L de R du Verge to John Davis
Despatches from United States consuls in St. Paul de Loanda, 1854-1893

revisionDesc.change: Creation of individual xml file, transcription, encoding.

div1.p: United States Consulate. St Paul de Loanda December 14th, 1882
Hon: John Davis Asst. Sectry of State Washington D.C.

Sir I have the honor to enclose herewith a translated copy o he letter from Jones Esqu. j the one of Thomas Foster's master of Bank Alice Knowles given to Henry Williams, sent on short at Massamdes for sickness. I also enclose his afford, and those of David Miller; Cebarles Sims, and Augustus Asau; amauay Am: Seamen; Cebarles Sims, and Augustus are also sick at present, and the Capt. of the Portuguese Steamer does not care to take them on board in their present condition.

They are now upon this consulate for over a month; and not expecting any Am: Vessel for the present; I shall be obliged to end them by some Portuguese merchant, to Lisbon, if the Capt. will take them, these have not any clothes, or shoes, but those given to them by this Consulate
I have the honor to be Sir Respectfully Your obedient servant L de R. du Verge US Consul.
